name: guilefully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that uses cleverness in order to deceive someone or get what you want: The soldiers guilefully lured the invading army into the forest and then surrounded them. The president guilefully waited until the final year of her term to announce the relief package so that voters would remember it when she ran for re-election. Related word
guileful
More examplesFewer examplesThe children's books are guilefully placed at the front of the store to lure in shoppers with young children. She guilefully waited until the last quarter's stellar earnings reports were released before approaching her boss with a request for a raise.
